title: How to Make a Clown Cake

steps.headline: Cut the small sponge cake into a triangular shape.
steps.description:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/eb\/Clown2_858.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/eb\/Clown2_858.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":566.96,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Curve the bottom into a small arch instead of a straight line.
steps.description:
Use the two side pieces that you carved out from the original cake and cut a third piece off from the opposite ends of each piece. The curved triangle will become the complete hat and the small piece will be the hat rim{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/42\/Clown3_871.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/42\/Clown3_871.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":566.96,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-a-clown-cake<\/a> shared with permission\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Frost the large sponge cake with the buttercream frosting.
steps.description:
Use a smooth, palette knife to give it a solid stroke all around. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/98\/Clown4_935.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/98\/Clown4_935.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.48,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-a-clown-cake<\/a>\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Mix the blue food coloring with the remaining frosting that you didn't use.
steps.description:
Use the new blue frosting with the hat. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7a\/Clown5_996.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7a\/Clown5_996.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":566.96,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-a-clown-cake<\/a>\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Place a few of the flying saucers down the center of the hat.
steps.description:
Make the rim by lining it with some dolly mixtures. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/aa\/Clown5_978.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/aa\/Clown5_978.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":325,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":536.56,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-a-clown-cake<\/a> shared with permission\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Use two chocolate buttons as eyes for the clown.
steps.description:
Put a dab of buttercream on two Smarties candies and stick it on the eyes for eyeballs. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/f6\/Clown7_560.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/f6\/Clown7_560.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.48,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-a-clown-cake<\/a> shared with permission\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Take a few Smarties (or similar candies) and form a "U" shape for the mouth.
Roll a chunk of red sugar paste into a ball.
steps.description:
Make it quite large, as it should dominate the cake to give it the real "clown feel". Place this on the cake for the nose. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/5c\/Clown9_114.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/5c\/Clown9_114.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-a-clown-cake<\/a> shared with permission\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Arrange strawberry laces around the sides of the face for hair.
steps.description: Use white and pink marshmallows around the cake's bottom for the ruff (or collar).

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description:
Candles can be added around the face for a birthday cake. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/f3\/Clown1_650.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/f3\/Clown1_650.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":566.96,"licensing":"

text:
Cut the small sponge cake into a triangular shape. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/e/eb/Clown2_858.PNG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/e/eb/Clown2_858.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":566.96,"licensing":"

http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-a-clown-cake shared with permission

License: Creative Commons

"} Curve the bottom into a small arch instead of a straight line. Use the two side pieces that you carved out from the original cake and cut a third piece off from the opposite ends of each piece. The curved triangle will become the complete hat and the small piece will be the hat rim{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/42/Clown3_871.PNG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/42/Clown3_871.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":566.96,"licensing":"

http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-a-clown-cake shared with permission

License: Creative Commons

"} Frost the large sponge cake with the buttercream frosting. Use a smooth, palette knife to give it a solid stroke all around. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/9/98/Clown4_935.PNG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/9/98/Clown4_935.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.48,"licensing":"

http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-a-clown-cake

License: Creative Commons

"} Mix the blue food coloring with the remaining frosting that you didn't use. Use the new blue frosting with the hat. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/7/7a/Clown5_996.PNG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/7/7a/Clown5_996.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":566.96,"licensing":"

http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-a-clown-cake

License: Creative Commons

"} Place a few of the flying saucers down the center of the hat. Make the rim by lining it with some dolly mixtures. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/a/aa/Clown5_978.PNG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/a/aa/Clown5_978.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":325,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":536.56,"licensing":"

http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-a-clown-cake shared with permission

License: Creative Commons

"} Use two chocolate buttons as eyes for the clown. Put a dab of buttercream on two Smarties candies and stick it on the eyes for eyeballs. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/f6/Clown7_560.PNG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/f6/Clown7_560.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.48,"licensing":"

http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-a-clown-cake shared with permission

License: Creative Commons

"} Take a few Smarties (or similar candies) and form a "U" shape for the mouth. Roll a chunk of red sugar paste into a ball. Make it quite large, as it should dominate the cake to give it the real "clown feel". Place this on the cake for the nose. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/5/5c/Clown9_114.PNG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/5/5c/Clown9_114.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-a-clown-cake shared with permission

License: Creative Commons

"} Arrange strawberry laces around the sides of the face for hair. Use white and pink marshmallows around the cake's bottom for the ruff (or collar). Serve. Candles can be added around the face for a birthday cake. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/f3/Clown1_650.PNG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/f3/Clown1_650.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":566.96,"licensing":"

http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-a-clown-cake shared with permission

License: Creative Commons

"}
sentences: Cut the small sponge cake into a triangular shape.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/eb\/Clown2_858.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/eb\/Clown2_858.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":566.96,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-a-clown-cake<\/a> shared with permission\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Curve the bottom into a small arch instead of a straight line.
Use the two side pieces that you carved out from the original cake and cut a third piece off from the opposite ends of each piece.

The curved triangle will become the complete hat and the small piece will be the hat rim{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/42\/Clown3_871.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/42\/Clown3_871.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":566.96,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-a-clown-cake<\/a> shared with permission\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Frost the large sponge cake with the buttercream frosting.
Use a smooth, palette knife to give it a solid stroke all around.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/98\/Clown4_935.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/98\/Clown4_935.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.48,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-a-clown-cake<\/a>\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Mix the blue food coloring with the remaining frosting that you didn't use.
Use the new blue frosting with the hat.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7a\/Clown5_996.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7a\/Clown5_996.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":566.96,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-a-clown-cake<\/a>\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Place a few of the flying saucers down the center of the hat.
Make the rim by lining it with some dolly mixtures.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/aa\/Clown5_978.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/aa\/Clown5_978.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":325,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":536.56,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-a-clown-cake<\/a> shared with permission\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Use two chocolate buttons as eyes for the clown.
Put a dab of buttercream on two Smarties candies and stick it on the eyes for eyeballs.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/f6\/Clown7_560.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/f6\/Clown7_560.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.48,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-a-clown-cake<\/a> shared with permission\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Take a few Smarties (or similar candies) and form a "U" shape for the mouth.
Roll a chunk of red sugar paste into a ball.
Make it quite large, as it should dominate the cake to give it the real "clown feel".
Place this on the cake for the nose.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/5c\/Clown9_114.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/5c\/Clown9_114.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-a-clown-cake<\/a> shared with permission\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Arrange strawberry laces around the sides of the face for hair.
Use white and pink marshmallows around the cake's bottom for the ruff (or collar).
Serve.
Candles can be added around the face for a birthday cake.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/f3\/Clown1_650.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/f3\/Clown1_650.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":566.96,"licensing":"

http:\/\/www.videojug.com\/film\/how-to-make-a-clown-cake<\/a> shared with permission\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}
